channel.title: Stargate Movie Reboot
channel.description: [url='https://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/news/a513056/stargate-to-receive-movie-reboot-trilogy-planned.html']So Roland Emmerich is trying to reboot Stargate...[/url] thoughts? Personally, I liked the 1994 movie, but the TV shows (except Universe) are the golden part of the Stargate franchise.

item.title: Stargate Movie Reboot
item.dc:creator: elevenbravo
item.description:
imadoofus:

I liked the movie more than a lot of people seem to, and I loved the TV shows (regarding Universe, I watched a bit and it was okay, but it just felt less like Stargate than SG-1 and Atlantis), so I would be really sad to see all that canon drop out of existence. I guess I could just pull the “alternate universe” card - they can’t stop me. Muahahahaha!

How the fuck do people bump a thread this old? lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Stargate Movie Reboot
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
JeffMOD:

What about this one?

I’d rather have a game that follows SG-1 and Atlantis’ lore.

Maxey:

Did you like the Ori storyline? Apparently Season 8 was planned out to be the last one but then Syfy renewed for more seasons so they had to pull a new enemy out of their hats.

I just read something interesting; it appears that the writers wanted to replace SG-1 with a show called “Stargate Command” after season 8, but SyFy wanted to continue SG-1 instead (for the money, most likely).

item.title: Stargate Movie Reboot
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
Maxey:

By reducing computer use on TV to big screens full of graphics and text everywhere where you can do anything by just tapping keys, you’re still getting the message across while not alienating half of your audience.

I know why it’s done, but that doesn’t make it any less dumb. It’s like saying “oh, let’s teach our kids at school that the earth is flat, because it would be much too complicated otherwise”.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Stargate Movie Reboot
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Real computer software is not very flashy and full of old sci-fi “ping” sounds.

The average TV viewer barely knows his way out of a computer. If movies and TV shows all showed real footage of computers and hacking, the viewers would not understand what’s happening and it would take more than just a few seconds to download a file or hack a supercomputer.

By reducing computer use on TV to big screens full of graphics and text everywhere where you can do anything by just tapping keys, you’re still getting the message across while not alienating half of your audience.

Read full topic

item.title: Stargate Movie Reboot
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
Oh yeah. The scene where he translates a computer virus on a human built spaceship, from binary to an alien programming language. Awesome science stuff. Almost ranks up there with this scene from CSI where one of the investigators was going to program a GUI in Visual Basic to track some criminal down.

I honestly never understood why they don’t get just get one IT guy to help out with the scripts and fix idiotic things like that. Heck, even having him click on the properties on an .exe file and seeing “Copyright © Wraith Corporation” would be more believable.

By the way, if you think there are no Asgard in Stargate Atlantis… besides Hermiod, you should dig around in your grey matter a bit for the season 5 episode “The Lost Tribe”.

Read full topic
